meanings.definition: Not assertive or confident in behavior or manner.
meanings.sent1: She is very unassertive and often lets others make decisions for her.
meanings.sent2: He comes across as unassertive in group settings, preferring to stay quiet.
meanings.sent3: The unassertive kitten timidly approached the big dog, unsure of what to do.
meanings.sent4: Her unassertive nature was like a whisper in a room full of loud voices.
meanings.sent5: The unassertive student struggled to speak up in class, blending into the background.

meanings.definition: Lacking the quality of being forceful or self-assured.
meanings.sent1: The unassertive response to the question showed his lack of confidence.
meanings.sent2: She gave an unassertive nod, not wanting to draw attention to herself.
meanings.sent3: The unassertive flower drooped its petals, looking shy among the vibrant blooms.
meanings.sent4: His unassertive handshake felt like holding a limp fish.
meanings.sent5: The unassertive breeze barely rustled the leaves, almost apologetic in its presence.
